articles.content:
Cause of Korean people supported 
    Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Chile (CPC) will as ever further develop the friendly and cooperative ties with the Workers' Party of Korea and extend full support and solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people, said general secretary of the CPC Central Committee Gladys Marin Milie on Sept. 9 when he met DPRK ambassador to Chile Yu Chang Un who paid a courtesy call on him.
 The general secretary said he was sincerely rejoiced over the achievements the Korean people have made in the building of a prosperous and powerful socialist nation under the wise army-first leadership of Kim Jong Il despite all sorts of economic difficulties.    
 He hoped that Korea would be reunified independently and peacefully in accordance with the line of national independence advanced by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Mongolian ambassador presents credentials to Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Mongolian ambassador presents credentials to Kim Yong Nam 
    Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Newly-appointed Mongolian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK Janchivdorjyn Lombo presented his credentials to Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there was vice-minister of foreign affairs Kim Yong Il.    
 After receiving the credentials, the president talked with the ambassador.

articles.title: Delegation of Chilean Senate here
articles.content:
Delegation of Chilean Senate here 
    Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Chilean Senate headed by its vice-president Mario Rios Santander arrived here today.
 It was greeted at the airport by Jang Chol, vice-chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.    
 The DSPAhosted a reception for the delegation this evening.
